description: Bullish reversal pattern with three troughs at approximately the same price level. Forms after a downtrend showing strong support that price cannot break below, indicating potential trend reversal.
validationRules: Must form after a clear downtrend
Three distinct troughs at roughly the same level (within 2-3%)
Resistance line connects the two peaks between troughs
Each trough should show buying pressure with volume
Breakout above resistance line confirms the pattern
Volume typically decreases on 2nd and 3rd troughs, increases on breakout
invalidationSignals: Price breaks below the support level (troughs)
Fourth trough forms - pattern becomes consolidation
Volume increases on 2nd or 3rd trough (sellers still active)
Pattern takes longer than 3 months (loses reliability)
commonMistakes: Expecting perfect symmetry - troughs can vary slightly
Not waiting for retest of broken resistance as support
Ignoring volume - should decrease on later troughs
Trading pattern in sideways range vs clear downtrend

tradeSetup.entry: Breakout above resistance line with volume, or retest of broken resistance as support
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Below the most recent trough or below all three troughs for conservative approach
tradeSetup.target: Measured move: height of pattern projected upward from breakout point

supportive: RSI showing bullish divergence at the troughs
Volume spike on resistance breakout (1.5x+ average)
Moving averages starting to curl upward
conflicting: Major resistance level just above resistance line

confluenceFactors: Troughs align with major support level
Multiple timeframe confirmation (visible on daily and weekly)
